title: Implement Curator meta bead generation for self-managing knowledge base
description:
Enable ACE Curator to create meta beads that track knowledge gaps, consolidation opportunities, and trigger multi-epoch learning. This makes the ACE system self-managing by having the Curator identify when it needs more data, when patterns should be consolidated, or when human review is needed.

## Context
The ACE framework has three roles:
- Generator: Executes tasks, discovers issues
- Reflector: Analyzes outcomes, extracts insights
- Curator: Integrates insights into knowledge/AGENT.md

Currently, the Curator only updates AGENT.md. This feature extends it to also create meta beads that manage the knowledge base lifecycle.

## Requirements

### 1. Curator Permission Updates
Update ~/custom-subagent/src/subagents.ts to allow Curator to create beads:
- Add: createPermission('Bash', 'allow', { matches: { cmd: 'bd create*' } })
- Add: createPermission('Bash', 'allow', { matches: { cmd: 'bd dep*' } })

### 2. Meta Bead Scenarios
Curator should create beads in these situations:

**A. Insufficient Evidence (confidence < 0.6)**
When Reflector generates insight with low confidence:
\`\`\`bash
bd create "Collect evidence: [pattern description]" -t chore -p 4 --json
# Add label: meta-learning
# Description: Need 3+ more examples of [pattern] to reach confidence threshold
\`\`\`

**B. Conflicting Feedback (harmful > helpful/2)**
When bullet has mixed helpful/harmful tracking:
\`\`\`bash
bd create "Review Bullet #X with conflicting feedback" -t task -p 3 --json
# Add label: review-needed
# Description: Bullet #X marked helpful:3 harmful:2. Investigate context to refine or remove.
\`\`\`

**C. Consolidation Opportunity (5+ similar bullets)**
When multiple bullets cover similar patterns:
\`\`\`bash
bd create "Consolidate [topic] bullets into meta-pattern" -t chore -p 3 --json
# Add label: consolidation
# Link to all source bullets with related dependencies
# Description: Bullets #X, #Y, #Z all address [topic]. Extract higher-level pattern.
\`\`\`

**D. Multi-Epoch Learning Trigger (10+ related completed tasks)**
When enough work completed in domain for batch learning:
\`\`\`bash
bd create "Multi-epoch learning: [domain] patterns" -t epic -p 2 --json
# Add label: offline-learning
# Description: 10+ auth-related tasks completed. Run batch analysis for meta-patterns.
\`\`\`

**E. Knowledge Maintenance (periodic)**
Stale or harmful bullets needing cleanup:
\`\`\`bash
bd create "Archive or refine Bullet #X (harmful:N > helpful:M)" -t chore -p 3 --json
# Add label: maintenance
# Description: Bullet consistently marked harmful. Archive to knowledge/archive/ or refine.
\`\`\`

### 3. Curator System Prompt Update
Add this section to ace-curator system prompt in ~/custom-subagent/src/subagents.ts:

\`\`\`
## Meta Bead Generation

In addition to updating AGENT.md, create meta beads to manage knowledge lifecycle:

1. **Low confidence insights** (< 0.6):
   - Create chore bead to collect more evidence
   - Priority 4 (backlog)
   - Auto-close when 3+ supporting tasks completed

2. **Conflicting feedback** (harmful > helpful/2):
   - Create task bead for human review
   - Priority 3
   - Include context about when marked helpful vs harmful

3. **Consolidation opportunity** (5+ similar bullets):
   - Create chore bead to merge patterns
   - Priority 3
   - Link all source bullets with related dependencies

4. **Epoch learning trigger** (10+ completed tasks in domain):
   - Create epic bead for multi-epoch analysis
   - Priority 2
   - Group by labels (auth, typescript, build, etc.)

5. **Stale/harmful patterns** (harmful > helpful):
   - Create maintenance bead to archive or refine
   - Priority 3
   - Move to knowledge/archive/ if consistently harmful

Always add appropriate labels: meta-learning, review-needed, consolidation, offline-learning, maintenance
\`\`\`

### 4. Implementation Files to Modify

**File: ~/custom-subagent/src/subagents.ts**
- Update ace-curator permissions (add bd create and bd dep commands)
- Update ace-curator system prompt (add Meta Bead Generation section)

### 5. Test Scenario

Create test that validates meta bead generation:

\`\`\`typescript
// scripts/test-meta-beads.ts
// 1. Simulate low-confidence insight → verify chore bead created
// 2. Simulate conflicting feedback → verify review bead created
// 3. Simulate 5 similar bullets → verify consolidation bead created
// 4. Simulate 10 completed auth tasks → verify epoch bead created
\`\`\`

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Curator can create beads (permissions updated)
- [ ] System prompt includes meta bead generation rules
- [ ] Low-confidence insights create evidence-collection beads
- [ ] Conflicting feedback creates review beads
- [ ] Similar patterns create consolidation beads
- [ ] Sufficient completed work creates epoch learning beads
- [ ] All meta beads have appropriate labels
- [ ] Test scenario validates all meta bead types

## Benefits
- **Self-managing**: System identifies its own knowledge gaps
- **Quality control**: Detects and flags unreliable patterns
- **Scalability**: Triggers batch learning when enough data accumulated
- **Maintenance**: Prevents knowledge base bloat with stale bullets

## References
- ACE paper: https://arxiv.org/html/2510.04618v1 (Section on multi-epoch learning)

Implement mechanistic ACE Curator with semantic similarity and counter-based pruning
description:
Based on arxiv.org/html/2510.04618v1, implement the actual ACE framework methodology:

## Current Issues
- Curator system prompt is vague about decision process
- No semantic similarity thresholds defined (should be 0.85 for update, 0.90 for dedup)
- Missing counter-based feedback loop
- Too much complexity with meta-beads
- Not deterministic/mechanistic

## Implementation Requirements

### 1. Bullet Format in AGENT.md
- [Bullet #ID, helpful:N, harmful:M] Content describing strategy/pattern
- Store as structured data with unique IDs
- Track counters for helpful/harmful feedback

### 2. Generator Integration
- Mark bullets as helpful/harmful during task execution
- Report at completion: 'Bullet #23 helpful - predicted X'
- Track which bullets were referenced

### 3. Reflector Output Format
{
  "new_insights": [
    {
      "pattern": "Concrete pattern description",
      "trigger": "When this applies",
      "action": "Steps to take",
      "evidence": ["bd-42", "bd-51"],
      "confidence": "high|medium|low"
    }
  ],
  "bullet_updates": [
    {
      "bullet_id": 23,
      "feedback": "helpful|harmful",
      "reason": "Why it helped/harmed"
    }
  ]
}

### 4. Curator Deterministic Logic (Non-LLM)
- Calculate semantic similarity using embeddings (text-embedding-3-small)
- IF similarity > 0.85: UPDATE existing bullet (increment counter)
- IF similarity < 0.85: ADD new bullet (helpful:0, harmful:0)
- Lazy deduplication when AGENT.md > 10k tokens (similarity > 0.90)
- Never delete bullets except during deduplication
- Default to ACCUMULATE

### 5. Embedding Implementation
- Use text-embedding-3-small for semantic similarity
- Cosine similarity calculation
- Cache embeddings for existing bullets
- Thresholds: 0.85 (update), 0.90 (deduplicate)

### 6. Context Pruning Strategy
- Trigger: AGENT.md exceeds 10k tokens
- Method: Semantic deduplication (>0.90 similarity)
- Keep bullet with higher helpful count when merging
- Sum helpful/harmful counters
- Optional: Remove bullets with harmful > helpful*2

## Files to Create/Modify
1. mcp/embedding-client.ts - Semantic similarity calculation
2. mcp/curator-logic.ts - Deterministic bullet management
3. Update subagents.ts - Rewrite ace-curator and ace-reflector prompts
4. knowledge/AGENT.md - Add counter tracking format
5. tests/ace-curator.test.ts - Test deterministic logic

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Curator uses semantic similarity, not LLM judgment
- [ ] Counter-based feedback loop working
- [ ] Grow-and-refine strategy implemented
- [ ] Deduplication triggers at 10k tokens
- [ ] All decisions are reproducible/deterministic
- [ ] Generator can mark bullets helpful/harmful

title: Test auto-trigger of ACE learning cycle
ACE Framework Distribution - Make ACE portable via MCP server and Amp toolbox
notes:
Make ACE portable as a CLI tool that can be installed globally and used in any project.

Goals:
- npm install -g ace-beads (or similar)
- ace init - sets up ACE in current project
- ace learn - runs learning cycle  
- ace review - shows reviews
- Follows https://clig.dev/ best practices
- Optimized for AI agent use (Amp, Cursor, etc.)

Key CLI Principles (from clig.dev):
- JSON output with --json flag for programmatic use
- Exit codes: 0 on success, non-zero on failure
- Output to stdout, errors to stderr
- --plain for simple line-based output
- --quiet for suppressing non-essential output
- Crash-only, idempotent, recoverable
- No prompts with --no-input flag

This replaces the MCP server approach - CLI is simpler, more portable, and works with any tool.
